ygData.subject: RE: Charisma effect on magic resists
ygData.msgSnippet: Where is J.M. when you need him, this whole topic has become so obfuscated that we are defeating the purpose of helping one another and just confusing matters
ygData.messageBody:
Where is J.M. when you need him, this whole topic has become so obfuscated
that we are defeating the purpose of helping one another and just confusing
matters worse. So and so says this and so and so says that. I have heard
on the one hand the Smedley says CHA is used by bards and then someone else
says the opposite - as yet I still have no idea if the truth is out there.
Oh where oh where is my Scully to help me get to the bottom of this?

Faras the confused


> -----Original Message-----
> From: Chris Kuenster (Entex) [mailto:v-ntxck@...]
> Sent: Monday, August 09, 1999 12:52 PM
> To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] Charisma effect on magic resists
>
>
> From: "Chris Kuenster (Entex)" <v-ntxck@...>
>
> You must need incredible Dex then because my base is 124 and
> with a Shaman
> buff it is 161, I still miss alot of notes.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: John Robertson [mailto:johnr@...]
> Sent: Monday, August 09, 1999 10:05 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] Charisma effect on magic resists
>
>
> From: John Robertson <johnr@...>
>
> >
> > At 120 charisma I consider the number of missed notes I get to
> > be intolerable. I'd estimate I'm missing notes about 10%-20%
> > of the time on low-level songs (will have to test it some time
> > this week). If it's worse with lower charisma, I don't know
> > how any of you are able to stand it. I worked on my enchanter
> > this entire weekend because I actually get to play the game,
> > instead of assidiously watching the chat window for "missed
> > a note" messages. I played my bard again a couple hours
> > tonight, and half the time I didn't even know what was going
> > on or what song effects I had up because I was so busy trying
> > to watch for and recover from missed notes. It is very
> > frustrating.
>
> My understanding of this, based on conversations with some
> GMs and high
> level bards
> as well as my own experience is that missed notes is related
> to dexterity,
> not
> charisma. It's hard to notice a difference, because it's
> surely just a few
> percentage points, but I feel like I miss fewer notes with a
> grotesque mask
> on than
> without.
>
> Jyzan
>
>
